comments.body: I don't think that supporting two versions of the same param spelled differently is a good idea.

The problem that it depends on OS also, in centos7 and fedora29 it has older version with upper case, on rhel8 and fedora30 it has newer version with lower case. So if I don't cover it, tests will fail on two of OS. 
Maybe I'll leave there TODO to remove it when it has same version everywhere
So maybe just normalize the structs to be the same in all cases?
@webknjaz btw, do you have idea how to normalize it here? adding map('lower') or kind of?

Are you sure the newer version uses lower-case? According to the source: https://github.com/containers/libpod/blob/master/libpod/container_inspect.go#L114 I think it was added in containers/libpod#3312

older version uses lower case: 
```
Version:            1.3.2
RemoteAPI Version:  1
Go Version:         go1.10.3
OS/Arch:            linux/amd64
```

```
{
                "destination": "/tmp",
                "type": "bind",
                "source": "/tmp",
                "options": [
                    "rbind",
                    "rw",
                    "rprivate"
                ]
            },
```
